channel.title: RSS Feed for kepano
channel.description: RSS feed of the latest tweets from kepano.

item.title: "Feasting on Nature's Bounty: A Plum Adventure"
item.description:
we were hiking when we came across the most bountiful plum tree, with hundreds of the juiciest, sweetest, freshly fallen plums all around it, so we carried what we could in our hats and pockets and hands, and then feasted, made juice, torte, and basked in the glory of being alive pic.twitter.com/UrQGaMZXxA

— kepano (@kepano) July 20, 2024

item.title: AI Missteps: Companies Risk Reputation for Quick Gains
item.description:
it's kind of amazing that even well-run companies are shooting themselves in the foot, repeating the same mistakes over and over as they scramble to add AI everywhere

so much goodwill and reputation being destroyed because the incentives are too strong to resist https://t.co/Gh9pjMzdgq

— kepano (@kepano) July 2, 2024

item.title: "PMs Will Always Be PMs"
item.description:
PMs are gonna PMhttps://t.co/cJfra1rtj3

— kepano (@kepano) July 2, 2024

item.title: "Gen Z Values Ownership, Poised to Transform Markets"
item.description:
There are 2+ billion people under the age of 24 ‚Äî and from what I can tell they understand the value of ownership over renting better than their parents. This will change every market.

— kepano (@kepano) July 2, 2024

item.title: New Content Analysis Toggle for Adobe Users
item.description:
For @Adobe users there is a new "Content analysis" toggle which is enabled by default.

You can turn it off in your privacy settings if you don't want your Creative Cloud data used for training: pic.twitter.com/bDccHfA9NZ

— kepano (@kepano) June 5, 2024

item.title: Laughing at Kubrick's New Biography "An Odyssey"
item.description:
I'm reading the new Kubrick biography "An Odyssey" and this quote made me laugh pic.twitter.com/FRz5WqFEMM

— kepano (@kepano) July 3, 2024

item.title: Sync Uptime Now Public: 99.991% Across Servers
item.description:
we've been tracking Sync uptime metrics behind the scenes, but they're now public ‚Äî currently 99.991% uptime across servers

...that said, if a Sync server does go down, your local files are always there for you ü•∞ https://t.co/RtKO7sS7iW

— kepano (@kepano) August 26, 2024

item.title: Notion to Delete Data of Russian Users Due to Sanctions
item.description:
On September 9th, Notion will delete the data of all Russian users due to new U.S. sanctions.

This is why "file over app" is essential ‚Äî you should not be subject to the whims of platforms and governments. Be sovereign of your own data. pic.twitter.com/0uUZzBGjrV

— kepano (@kepano) August 28, 2024

item.description:
this little cheat sheet I made has been surprisingly helpful to me in learning piano scales and the circle of fifths pic.twitter.com/1zRc6dbGcj

— kepano (@kepano) August 21, 2024

item.title: Exploring Tool Opportunities for Obsidian‚Äôs .md and .canvas Files
item.description:
there is a massive amount of unexplored space for tools that interoperate with .md and .canvas files you create in Obsidian

we added the "tools" category to Gems of the Year last year (Quartz by @_jzhao won), I hope to see more entries in this category for 2024

— kepano (@kepano) August 25, 2024

item.title: Obsidian Mobile Startup Time Significantly Reduced to 1 Second
item.description:
Big improvement for Obsidian startup time on mobile.

My personal vault with 15k notes went from ~5s to 1s (cold start) on an iPhone 15 Pro. Trying to get it down to 500ms or less. https://t.co/MThEmm7zFp

— kepano (@kepano) August 27, 2024

item.title: Minify Your Obsidian Plugins for Faster Load Times!
item.description:
PSA for Obsidian plugin devs: remember to minify your plugin! This can reduce the load time of your plugin by 50-90%.

Make sure your build script for main.js includes minification. Your users will thank you ‚ò∫Ô∏è

— kepano (@kepano) August 28, 2024

item.title: iCloud Files Update: Faster Obsidian Startup Times
item.description:
you can now set your iCloud files to "Keep Downloaded" which significantly reduces startup time for Obsidian

(available on iOS18 and macOS Sequoia) pic.twitter.com/gpXgWIL8Lx

— kepano (@kepano) September 17, 2024

item.title: NotionHQ's Controversial Treatment of Artist Roman Muradov
item.description:
Incredibly slimy move by @NotionHQ to throw Roman Muradov under the bus ‚Äî an exceptional artist whom I have no qualms with and explicitly excluded in my response.

Why would you do that to the person who built the beloved Notion look? Such a sad choice.https://t.co/RPbvm93bdf pic.twitter.com/r9utoAmlNE

— kepano (@kepano) September 27, 2024

item.title: Natural Language Data Structuring Idea for ObsdmD Clipper
item.description:
an idea I've been playing with for the @obsdmd clipper ‚Äî interpret the page in natural language and turn the results into structured data pic.twitter.com/nCW3yFQl6o

— kepano (@kepano) September 19, 2024

item.description:
Another huge improvement to performance. You should see roughly 50% to 95% reduction in startup time when switching from Obsidian 1.6 to 1.7 https://t.co/GkyE6UgucJ

— kepano (@kepano) September 19, 2024

Prose over logoshttps://t.co/BpnyVEh8JK pic.twitter.com/Oo9iVBob99

item.title: Notion Team Reflects on Original Sketches' Unique Impact
item.description:
In the Fast Company piece, the Notion team makes a point of calling out Roman's original sketches which were more unique and distinctive than the end result ‚Äî and how they pushed him away from this directionhttps://t.co/mQdFdj62gG

— kepano (@kepano) September 27, 2024

item.title: "Static Sites: Faster, Cheaper, and More Control Over Content"
item.description:
Most people would be better off with a simple static site than Wordpress.

Static sites are faster, cheaper, and easier to edit. And because you own your content in plain text you can more easily switch site generator or host. You're not held hostage.

— kepano (@kepano) October 10, 2024

item.title: Obsidian Developers Release New APIs for Plugin Optimization
item.description:
Obsidian developers: new APIs and a useful checklist to make your plugins and themes feel snappier than ever https://t.co/6pBoUJtGYc

— kepano (@kepano) October 1, 2024

item.title: "Language Models: The Power of Infinite Patience"
item.description:
the most salient quality of language models is their ability to be infinitely patient

humans have low tolerance when dealing with someone who changes their mind often, or needs something explained twenty different ways

— kepano (@kepano) October 4, 2024

item.title: Why Obsidian Chooses User Support Over VC Funding
item.description:
Why @obsdmd is 100% user-supported and not backed by VC investors:

1. We want to stay small, we don't need to hire lots of people
2. We follow strict principles that we do not want compromise
3. Our users are happy to support us, we don't need VC money

Obsidian will not exist‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/zifdU7dKqJ

— kepano (@kepano) February 11, 2024

item.title: King Hyeonjong's Efforts to Preserve Royal Calligraphy
item.description:
Stone tablet of king Sejo's calligraphy

"During the wars the royal collection of art and calligraphy was decimated or dispersed. King Hyeonjong (r. 1659-1675) launched a project to collect calligraphy works written by preceding kings and carve them into stone." pic.twitter.com/sLddAZBQRh

— kepano (@kepano) October 25, 2024

item.title: "Understanding Context: The Importance of Subtlety in Art"
item.description:
Subtlety matters ‚Äî it's not that the drawings are so unique, it's their use within a specific context. I shouldn't have made the assumption that people seeing this tweet would already know theses facts:

- We compete within the same narrow market
- The Notion team knows me well
-‚Ä¶

— kepano (@kepano) September 28, 2024

item.title: New Context Shared on Twitter by kepano
item.description:
Context:https://t.co/DbeGNHZxfv

— kepano (@kepano) October 10, 2024

item.title: Graphic Designer Wanted for Paid Merch Opportunity
item.description:
Paid opportunity ‚Ä¢ looking for graphic designer who is an Obsidian user to work on some merch designs ‚Ä¢ DM me your work!

here's the moodboard pic.twitter.com/f6DwreSpeG

— kepano (@kepano) October 6, 2024

item.title: Protect Your Data: Beware of AI Training Usage
item.description:
if your data is stored in a database that a company can freely read and access (i.e. not end-to-end encrypted), the company will eventually update their ToS so they can use your data for AI training ‚Äî the incentives are too strong to resist

— kepano (@kepano) August 7, 2023

item.title: Obsidian Mobile Load Times Improved by 50% to 95%
item.description:
With this update you should see a 50% to 95% reduction in the load time for Obsidian on mobile. My personal vault is about 14k notes and loads in less than a second ü•∞

(and the new Sync History view is incredibly useful if you share a vault with friends or coworkers) https://t.co/nn6jntgEfY

— kepano (@kepano) October 16, 2024

item.title: Notion Inspired by Doodling, Claims Twitter User
item.description:
1. no, I don't think I invented doodling
2. yes, I do think Notion directly used this as inspiration because the four employees quoted in the press piece all follow me
3. iconic characters are made from simple lines, that's what makes them iconic ‚Äî think Bart, Calvin, Tintin,‚Ä¶

— kepano (@kepano) September 26, 2024

item.title: "D√©j√† Vu: NotionHQ Sparks Recall for User"
item.description:
where have I seen this before @NotionHQ ü§î pic.twitter.com/0TApMp6Q5i

— kepano (@kepano) September 25, 2024

item.title: Static vs Dynamic Sites: A Simple Comparison
item.description:
Static vs dynamic sites in the simplest terms I can think of:

Static sites are like printed books. You write your content in an app like Obsidian, and then a tool turns that into a complete, self-contained website. The pages don't change unless you make updates and "reprint" the‚Ä¶

— kepano (@kepano) October 10, 2024

item.title: Call for a Visual Editor in Static Site Development
item.description:
What's missing from the static site flow is a visual editor that makes the initial setup and design process more friendly. Someone should make this!

— kepano (@kepano) October 10, 2024

item.description:
write once, publish everywhere

your personal site should be the source of truth

Shaun is the designer behind sci-fi interfaces you've seen in Andor, Rogue One, Prometheus, Pacific Rim, Mission Impossible, etc, etc

item.title: "Enhancing Research Processes with Web Clipper Tool"
item.description:
So much of my research process takes place in the browser, but browsers are designed for reading/viewing more than writing/thinking.

Web Clipper has radically improved how I think because it makes it easier to reference and expand on world knowledge within my notes. https://t.co/UxBWskKWFi

— kepano (@kepano) November 11, 2024

why does anyone use Edge? üòì pic.twitter.com/mQHrg2xt7p

item.title: Urgent Help Needed for Microsoft Partner Center Review
item.description:

— kepano (@kepano) November 5, 2024

item.title: The Power of Self-Guaranteeing Promises in Business
item.description:
Self-guaranteeing¬†promises

Companies break promises all the time. A self-guaranteeing promise does not require you to trust anyone. You can verify a self-guaranteeing promise yourself.

File over app is a self-guaranteeing promise. If files are in your control, in an open‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/rIMpTXNCiY

— kepano (@kepano) December 3, 2024

item.title: "Beware the Tomte: Mischievous Spirits of the Workshop"
item.description:
"It is said that when carpenters take a break from their work, the tomte can be seen working on the house with their little axes."

"They can be irritable and vindictive when insulted. The tomte's wrath cannot be taken lightly due to their immense strength despite their size." pic.twitter.com/VoOFe1Q2J7

— kepano (@kepano) December 23, 2024

if there is I want to go there next https://t.co/4hH3FS0ntx

item.title: Embracing Plain Text Accounting: Tools and UIs Featured
item.description:
Plain text accounting is the approach that most aligns with file over app.

Several good tools already exist: Ledger, Hledger, Beancount, Tackler. Friendly UIs are also popping up like Paisa and Fava. See https://t.co/TSIsf0YOND

— kepano (@kepano) December 27, 2024

item.title: "Editing Websites with Obsidian 1.8: A Quick Demo"
item.description:
a quick demo of how I edit my website with Obsidian 1.8

write in @obsdmd ‚Üí auto-build jekyll ‚Üí preview local site in web viewer tab ‚Üí push to github ‚Üí auto-deploy to live site

I've been making websites for twenty five years, and this is by far the nicest it's ever been pic.twitter.com/Dlw7Iorxop

— kepano (@kepano) December 19, 2024

item.title: "Annual Reflection: 40 Questions Across 30 Languages"
item.description:
Each year I ask myself these 40 questions.

This will be my eleventh year. It's still one of my favorite rituals. It helps me see how phases of my life wax and wane.

Each year since 2016, new translations come in. We're up to 30 languages! Thank you to all the contributors ü•∞ https://t.co/bh6hH991vg

— kepano (@kepano) December 4, 2024

item.title: "Tracking My Work: Blog Insights and Future Goals"
item.description:
99% of the work is keeping track of the things I do, which is explained on my blog here:https://t.co/X0QkSAYzxN

the visualization is a simple web app that takes the data and displays it using my Flexoki color scheme... maybe a 2025 goal is to make this a real Obsidian plugin?

— kepano (@kepano) December 31, 2024

item.title: "Accounting App Bench Shuts Down Without Warning"
item.description:
The accounting tool @Bench shut down with no warning 3 days before the end of the year. They had raised $110m in venture capital.

The app is no longer accessible. There will be a way to export your data, but it's not available yet.

File over app is not just for individuals. pic.twitter.com/xJdNFNRaKg

— kepano (@kepano) December 27, 2024

item.title: "Create Your Own Space: Build on the Web"
item.description:
You built a house on someone else's land, and then they tore it down.

Build a house on your own land. From there you can create roads, bridges, tunnels to other people's land.

On the web land is infinite. You can make your own land.

— kepano (@kepano) January 6, 2025

item.title: The Magic of Mastering Skills with Time
item.description:
one fun thing about getting older is simply the raw amount of time you've had to invest 10,000 hours into multiple different skills

if you're curious and carve a path through the skill tree, your skills become second nature and intertwine in ways that can seem magical https://t.co/zEEYZvHsQR

— kepano (@kepano) January 7, 2025

item.title: "Flexoki: Vibrant Colors That Emulate Pigment on Paper"
item.description:
The problem is that using opacity to lighten a color makes it appear washed out.

Flexoki emulates the feeling of pigment on paper by exponentially increasing intensity as colors get lighter or darker. This makes the colors feel vibrant and warm, like watercolor. pic.twitter.com/KYhBeOcXcA

— kepano (@kepano) January 7, 2025

item.title: "Flexoki 2.0 Features Exponential Colorfulness for Natural Pigment"
item.description:
The darker values in Flexoki 2.0 also follow this exponential colorfulness to maintain a highly pigmented, natural feeling. pic.twitter.com/BLrcIjqfUI

— kepano (@kepano) January 7, 2025

item.title: "Creators Need Their Own Space Beyond YouTube and Platforms"
item.description:
You have to think of YouTube and other platforms as a mechanism for distribution, not a source of truth.

If you're a creator it's essential to have your own place on the web were you can host and publish anything without fear that it will be taken down for any reason ‚Äî even‚Ä¶ https://t.co/4GpHaGG8OF

— kepano (@kepano) January 6, 2025

item.title: "Endless Love for Frangipane!"
item.description:
there can never be too much frangipane pic.twitter.com/jgL8Ic7w2o

item.title: Sony RX100V: My All-Time Favorite Camera
item.description:
I have had dozens of cameras but the Sony RX100V is my favorite camera I have ever owned:

- tiny, fits in any pocket
- has an excellent pop-up viewfinder
- starts shooting faster than opening an app
- goes down to f1.8, ideal for low depth of field, fast moving subjects, low‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/OHGjmtxXkR

— kepano (@kepano) January 10, 2025

item.title: Transcending Reality: The Purpose of Every Camera
item.description:
the purpose of every camera is to transcend reality ¬∑ to convert a moment into a memory ¬∑ to make the physical ethereal ¬∑ when scuffs and scars embroider the body it is the fulfillment of a search for the ragged edge of ephemerality https://t.co/JmLCGQN4Xp

— kepano (@kepano) January 11, 2025

item.title: Emphasizing File Control Over Applications for Lasting Digital Artifacts
item.description:
File over app

File over app¬†is a philosophy: if you want to create digital artifacts that last, they must be files you can control, in formats that are easy to retrieve and read. Use tools that give you this freedom.

File over app is an appeal to tool makers: accept that all‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/DUhRU7HkYv

— kepano (@kepano) July 2, 2023

item.title: Designing Flexoki 2.0: A New Color Tool
item.description:
Here's a little tool I built to design Flexoki 2.0. I wanted artistic control over ramping while still interpolating colors programmatically with Oklab.

In the future it could be used to create more hues and emulate watercolor pigment types within the Flexoki color space. pic.twitter.com/3UwH0VwEkY

— kepano (@kepano) January 9, 2025

item.title: "Navigating the Balance of Science and Art"
item.description:
Flexoki has been a battle between my competing desires in science and art. One part of my brain searches for reliability and precision, while another part searches for those elusive imperfections that remind us what feels real.

I hope you find it useful. https://t.co/EQ6f8Lsv82

— kepano (@kepano) January 7, 2025

item.title: Flexoki 2.0 Enhances Color Vibrancy and Warmth
item.description:
Flexoki 2.0 adds a full range of values for every color.

The feeling of pigment on paper is emulated by exponentially increasing intensity as colors get lighter or darker. This makes colors feel vibrant and warm, rather than washed out. pic.twitter.com/OMI6iRCk6K

— kepano (@kepano) January 7, 2025

item.title: Flexoki 2.0 Launches with 88 New Watercolor-Inspired Colors
item.description:
Flexoki 2.0 introduces 88 new colors that feel like watercolor pigments on paper.

This is a continuation of my attempt to bring the feeling of analog color to digital emissive screens.

Flexoki 1.0 only provided the a range of values for the grayscale colors. What I have been‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/ol4LDMl6Ce

— kepano (@kepano) January 7, 2025

item.title: Introducing Flexoki: A Striking Inky Color Scheme
item.description:
Flexoki, an inky color scheme for prose and codehttps://t.co/Fxcz6HJFIs

— kepano (@kepano) January 7, 2025

item.title: "Exploring Color Mixing: Ink vs. Digital Screens"
item.description:
Ink on paper is a subtractive process whereas LCD and OLED screens use additive color. Replicating the effect of mixing pigments digitally is difficult. pic.twitter.com/fWVphwYZ5L

— kepano (@kepano) January 7, 2025
